verses.verse: I am come <WH935> into my garden, <WH1588> my sister, <WH269> my spouse: <WH3618> I have gathered <WH717> my myrrh <WH4753> with <WH5973> my spice; <WH1313> I have eaten <WH398> my honeycomb <WH3293> with <WH5973> my honey; <WH1706> I have drunk <WH8354> my wine <WH3196> with <WH5973> my milk: <WH2461> eat, <WH398> O friends; <WH7453> drink, <WH8354> yea, drink abundantly, <WH7937> O beloved. <WH1730>

I <WH589> sleep, <WH3463> but my heart <WH3820> waketh: <WH5782> it is the voice <WH6963> of my beloved <WH1730> that knocketh, <WH1849> saying, Open <WH6605> to me, my sister, <WH269> my love, <WH7474> my dove, <WH3123> my undefiled: <WH8535> for my head <WH7945> <WH7218> is filled <WH4390> with dew, <WH2919> and my locks <WH6977> with the drops <WH7447> of the night. <WH3915>
I have put off <WH6584> <WH853> my coat; <WH3801> how <WH349> shall I put it on? <WH3847> I have washed <WH7364> <WH853> my feet; <WH7272> how <WH349> shall I defile <WH2936> them?
My beloved <WH1730> put in <WH7971> his hand <WH3027> by <WH4480> the hole <WH2356> of the door, and my bowels <WH4578> were moved <WH1993> for <WH5921> him.

I <WH589> rose up <WH6965> to open <WH6605> to my beloved; <WH1730> and my hands <WH3027> dropped <WH5197> with myrrh, <WH4753> and my fingers <WH676> with sweet smelling <WH5674> myrrh, <WH4753> upon <WH5921> the handles <WH3709> of the lock. <WH4514>

I <WH589> opened <WH6605> to my beloved; <WH1730> but my beloved <WH1730> had withdrawn <WH2559> himself, and was gone: <WH5674> my soul <WH5315> failed <WH3318> when he spoke: <WH1696> I sought <WH1245> him, but I could not <WH3808> find <WH4672> him; I called <WH7121> him, but he gave me no answer. <WH3808> <WH6030>

The watchmen <WH8104> that went about <WH5437> the city <WH5892> found <WH4672> me, they smote <WH5221> me, they wounded <WH6481> me; the keepers <WH8104> of the walls <WH2346> took away <WH5375> <WH853> my veil <WH7289> from <WH4480> <WH5921> me.

I charge <WH7650> you, O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> if <WH518> ye find <WH4672> <WH853> my beloved, <WH1730> that <WH4100> ye tell <WH5046> him, that I <WH589> am sick <WH7945> <WH2470> of love. <WH160>

What <WH4100> is thy beloved <WH1730> more than another beloved, <WH4480> <WH1730> O thou fairest <WH3303> among women? <WH802> what <WH4100> is thy beloved <WH1730> more than another beloved, <WH4480> <WH1730> that thou dost so <WH7945> <WH3602> charge <WH7650> us?
My beloved <WH1730> is white <WH6703> and ruddy, <WH122> the chiefest <WH1713> among ten thousand. <WH4480> <WH7233>
His head <WH7218> is as the most <WH3800> fine gold, <WH6337> his locks <WH6977> are bushy, <WH8534> and black <WH7838> as a raven. <WH6158>
His eyes <WH5869> are as the eyes of doves <WH3123> by <WH5921> the rivers <WH650> of waters, <WH4325> washed <WH7364> with milk, <WH2461> and fitly set. <WH4402> <WH3427>
His cheeks <WH3895> are as a bed <WH6170> of spices, <WH1314> as sweet <WH4840> flowers: <WH4026> his lips <WH8193> like lilies, <WH7799> dropping <WH5197> sweet smelling <WH5674> myrrh. <WH4753>
His hands <WH3027> are as gold <WH2091> rings <WH1550> set <WH4390> with the beryl: <WH8658> his belly <WH4578> is as bright <WH6247> ivory <WH8127> overlaid <WH5968> with sapphires. <WH5601>

His legs <WH7785> are as pillars <WH5982> of marble, <WH8336> set <WH3245> upon <WH5921> sockets <WH134> of fine gold: <WH6337> his countenance <WH4758> is as Lebanon, <WH3844> excellent <WH977> as the cedars. <WH730>

His mouth <WH2441> is most sweet: <WH4477> yea, he is altogether <WH3605> lovely. <WH4261> This <WH2088> is my beloved, <WH1730> and this <WH2088> is my friend, <WH7453> O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem. <WH3389>
